meanings.definition: To cover or sprinkle with dust.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bedust the old bookshelf before painting it.
meanings.sent2: The wind will bedust the windows with sand during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to bedust the entire room with flour.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was bedusted with memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully bedusted the ancient artifacts to reveal their true beauty.

meanings.definition: To become covered or sprinkled with dust.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the neglected furniture will slowly bedust.
meanings.sent2: The old attic tends to bedust quickly due to lack of use.
meanings.sent3: The playful children always manage to bedust themselves with dirt after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The forgotten memories began to bedust in the corners of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned car sat in the field, slowly becoming bedusted by nature's elements.
